channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: David Gomoh murder: Gang members jailed for NHS worker stabbing
item.description: David Gomoh managed to stagger back home before dying in front of his family.

item.title: Mother of boy killed by dog in Cornwall 'truly sorry'
item.description: Frankie Macritchie asked his mum to leave the dog when she went to check on him, an inquest hears

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Experts 'stunned' by police misapprehension
item.description: A terrorism expert says it is "beyond surprising" senior police did not know about arena failures.

item.title: Dorman Long tower to be destroyed after listed status revoked
item.description: Nadine Dorries strips Historic England protection from the 1950s Dorman Long building.

item.title: Wetherspoons stairs death in Bournemouth came after other falls
item.description: Philip Shaw died after tripping on a steep staircase at a pub in Bournemouth, an inquest hears.

item.title: Liverpool fireplace fall: Dad's warning as girl, 6, left in coma
item.description: Six-year-old Alexa-Leigh was playing when a marble fireplace fell on her, her father says.

item.title: Walleys Quarry: Family can stay in home after landfill emissions victory
item.description: The High Court has ruled that stricter controls must be imposed on Walleys Quarry in Staffordshire.

item.title: Jodey Whiting: Family lose appeal for new inquest over benefits death
item.description: Jodey Whiting's family wanted a new inquest to consider the impact of benefit cuts on her death.

item.title: Sheffield stabbing: Man dies in city centre attack
item.description: A murder investigation begins and a suspect in his 30s is arrested over the attack in Sheffield.

item.title: Manchester Metrolink: Man who fell between trams has leg amputated
item.description: The man, who fell between two linked trams in Manchester, remains in a critical condition.

item.title: M25 protests: Priti Patel calls activists 'selfish'
item.description: Further protests are taking place on the London orbital motorway, as well as the M1, M3 and M11.

item.title: British Pie Awards: Meat pie triumphs despite rise of vegan bakes
item.description: The traditional bake rose to the top, beating a high number of vegan entries.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Sheringham 125-year-old shipwreck revealed by calm weather
item.description: The sunken vessel is rarely seen due to ever-changing conditions at sea.

item.title: Digbeth scene hopes to see street art across Birmingham
item.description: The Digbeth street culture festival is back - with a dream to see artwork across Birmingham.

item.title: Education in prison: 'If I can do it, anyone canâ€™
item.description: Two prisoners describe how their education inside took them on a different path.

item.title: Signalman jailed for Doncaster level crossing crash with Azuma train
item.description: Footage shows Michael Rochford ploughing into the side of a high-speed train at a level crossing.

item.title: Six jailed after Watford car chase killing of Luke O'Connell
item.description: The group used a samurai sword, machete and wrench in an attack on three people in a car.

item.title: Europa League: Fans arrested over Leicester City v Napoli violence
item.description: Nine men are detained after Leicester City and Napoli supporters clash.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter: New TV mast could be working by 5 October
item.description: The new temporary mast should serve 90% of homes covered by the fire-damaged Bilsdale transmitter.

item.title: Birmingham raids target 'major illegal streaming network'
item.description: Police make three arrests over a platform thought to have served hundreds of thousands of customers.

item.title: First baby red squirrels born at Wiltshire safari park
item.description: The kits, a boy and three girls, were bred at Longleat as part of a UK-wide breeding programme.

item.title: Steph Houghton: England captain out of World Cup qualifier with ankle injury
item.description: England captain Steph Houghton is out of Friday's World Cup qualifier against North Macedonia because of an ankle injury.

item.title: Emma Raducanu on watching her US Open final, meeting Lewis Hamilton & her mum's cooking
item.description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu says it felt like somebody else was playing as she watched Saturday's final for the first time on returning home.

item.title: 'Derby could stay up with nine-point deduction' - Rooney
item.description: Derby County can still survive in the Championship even if hit with a nine-point deduction, says boss Wayne Rooney.
